[Home](./index.md) &gt; [assistive-playwright-client](./assistive-playwright-client.md) &gt; [VMMouse](./assistive-playwright-client.vmmouse.md) &gt; [move](./assistive-playwright-client.vmmouse.move.md)

## VMMouse.move() method

Moves the mouse to the specified position, expressed either as coordinates in the viewport (relative to the top-left corner), or coordinates relative to the center of the DOM element passed as `origin` in the `options`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
move(x: number, y: number, options?: {
        steps?: number | undefined;
        origin?: ElementHandle<HTMLElement | SVGElement> | null;
    }): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  x | number | horizontal destination position of the mouse in pixels |
|  y | number | vertical destination position of the mouse in pixels |
|  options | { steps?: number \| undefined; origin?: ElementHandle&lt;HTMLElement \| SVGElement&gt; \| null; } | <code>steps</code>: number of steps to use when moving the mouse from its current position to the destination, defaults to <code>1</code> <code>origin</code>: DOM element whose center is the origin of the coordinates passed in <code>x</code> and <code>y</code>. If null or undefined, the coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the viewport. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;
